Articles.Content:
So I'm experiencing unstable gameplay, with frequent crashes - mostly when switching from vessels to buildings, as well as quicksaving/loading.

Also, when mousing over stack decouplers in the stage sequence, graphic errors occur.

Specs:

Kubuntu 15.04 32-bit

Intel Core [\[email protected\]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)

GeForce GT 650M

8GB Ram

Mods installed: 

Kerbal Alarm Clock

Interstellar 1.3.5

KW Rocketry

ScanSat

MechJeb

Kerbal Attachment System

ATM Aggressive

RemoteTech

All mods updated.

Running from Steam with argument LC\_ALL=C.

Player Log:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/6h1vx6lu1ws91gr/Player.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/6h1vx6lu1ws91gr/Player.log?dl=0)

Anything else you need to know, I'll be happy to provide.

Thank you very much in advance!

OutOfMemoryException: Out of memory

try starting the ./KSP.x86\_64 binary directly from the game directory (if you have a 64 Bit OS installed)

> 
> OutOfMemoryException: Out of memory
> 
> 
> 
> 
> try starting the ./KSP.x86\_64 binary directly from the game directory (if you have a 64 Bit OS installed)

Kubuntu 15.04 32-bit.

> 
> Kubuntu 15.04 32-bit.

Why did you install the 32bit version on a machine with more than 4GB RAM? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Uh, yeah. There's no reason to run a 32bit OS on even remotely modern hardware.

Step1: Install 64bit GNU/Linux (or switch up your current distro if you know what you're doing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

Step2: Switch to 64bit KSP

Step3: Add moar mods ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Step1: Install 64bit GNU/Linux (or switch up your current distro if you know what you're doing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

I don't, but I have professional Kubuntu tech support at hand ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I just thought it was a general rule, cross-OS that KSP wouldn't run well on 64-bit systems.

Thanks, I'll try it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
It's the x64 build of the Unity3d engine that has issues... Serious issues on Windows, not so much on GNU/Linux. In either case, a 64bit OS is all good.

Complete reinstall with Kubuntu 15.04 64-bit - and met by this:

![MvmeCfw.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/MvmeCfw.png?1)

Clean install, no mods. Tried installing mods, no change.

Any good ideas?

Try disabling AA (use GPU driver AA) & "Edge Highlighting (PPFX)" in settings.

- - - Updated - - -

It's a known bug, here's the [bug report](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/3859).
